SlightCSV
Simple and lightweight CSV parser library written in C++.

Detailed Description

The "main" class of the library. Provides methods for setting up the library, triggering data processing and getting the results.

Member Function Documentation

◆ getCell()

template<class T >
template void utils::SlightCSV::getCell ( T &  t_value,
const size_t  t_row_index,
const size_t  t_column_index 
) const

Method to get the contents of a specific cell. The internal data structure stores cell values as strings. When using the method, the library tries to convert the string contents to the type supplied as the first parameter of the method. Supported types: int, float, double, string. If conversion fails, the value returned will be 0. In this case, it is always possible to get the value as string.

Parameters
t_valuevariable to hold the value of the cell.
t_row_indexindex (starting from 0) of the row the cell queried.
t_column_indexindex (starting from 0) of the column holding the cell queried.
See also
getRow()
getColumn()

◆ getColumn() [1/3]

template<class T >
void utils::SlightCSV::getColumn ( vector< T > &  t_target_column,
const size_t  t_column_index 
) const

Method to get the cells of a specific column. The column is represented in the form of a vector. The internal data structure stores cell values as strings. When using the method, the library tries to convert the string contents to the type held by the vector supplied as the method. Supported types: int, float, double, string. If conversion fails, the value returned will be 0. In this case, it is always possible to get the value as string.

Parameters
t_target_columnvector to hold the values of the cells in the column.
t_column_indexindex (starting from 0) of the column to be returned.
See also
getRow()
getCell()

void utils::SlightCSV::getColumn ( vector< T > &  t_target_column,
const size_t  t_column_index,
const size_t  t_start_cell_index 
) const

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts. Method to get the cells of a specific column. The column is represented in the form of a vector. The internal data structure stores cell values as strings. When using the method, the library tries to convert the string contents to the type held by the vector supplied as the method. Supported types: int, float, double, string. If conversion fails, the value returned will be 0. In this case, it is always possible to get the value as string.

Parameters
t_target_columnvector to hold the values of the cells in the column.
t_column_indexindex (starting from 0) of the column to be returned.
t_start_cell_indexindex (starting from 0) of the first vertical cell (filtering).

When using the method, the library tries to convert the string contents to the type held by the vector supplied as the method. Supported types: int, float, double, string. If conversion fails, the value returned will be 0. In this case, it is always possible to get the value as string.

Returns
the number of records loaded.
See also

◆ reset()

void utils::SlightCSV::reset ( void  )

Method to reset the library to its initial state. Unloads any data structure loaded previously and resets settings to their initial state. Optional, library will not leak if not used.

◆ setEscape()

void utils::SlightCSV::setEscape ( const string  t_escape)

Method to set the escape character. It is used to escape other characters in the file to be processed. Escaped delimiter and new line characters are not processed and are propagated to processed "cells". Setting (or not setting) the escape character not in accordance with the file format may trigger exceptions (e.g. cell count mismatch in row). Order of execution: strip, escape, replace. Characters enclosed between escape characters will be escaped even if escape characters are stripped or replaced. Method is optional. If used, set it before triggering data loading.

Parameters
t_escapecharacter to be used to escape a group of characters in the input.
See also
getEscape()

◆ setFileName()

void utils::SlightCSV::setFileName ( const string  t_filename)

Method to set the name of the CSV file to be parsed. Required before triggering data loading.

Parameters
t_filenamename and relative path of the file.
See also
getFileName()

◆ setHeaderCount()

void utils::SlightCSV::setHeaderCount ( const size_t  t_header_count)

Method to override and set the number of header rows in the output of the parser. The library tries to detect and count header rows automatically.

Parameters
t_header_countthe number of header rows at the beginning of the CSV file.
See also
getHeaderCount()

◆ setReplaceChars()

void utils::SlightCSV::setReplaceChars ( const map< string, string > &  t_rep_chars)

Method to define a map of character pair(s) to be replaced in the input of the parser. The map's "key" character is replaced by the "value" character in the input. Order of execution: strip, escape, replace. Escape characters may be replaced, but characters enclosed between escape characters will be escaped and present in the output. Stripped characters won't be seen by the method. Optional method. If used, set it before triggering data loading.

Parameters
t_rep_charsa map of "replacee" and "replacer" characters.
See also
getReplaceChars()

◆ setSeparator()

void utils::SlightCSV::setSeparator ( const string  t_separator)

Method to set the delimiter character. It is used as a separator between "cells" in a row. Required before triggering data loading.

Parameters
t_separatorcharacter to use as delimiter.
See also
getSeparator()

◆ setStripChars()

void utils::SlightCSV::setStripChars ( const set< string > &  t_strip_chars)

Method to define a set of character(s) to be stripped from the input of the parser. Order of execution: strip, escape, replace. Escape characters may be stripped, but characters enclosed between escape characters will be escaped and present in the output. Stripped characters won't be seen by replace. Optional method. If used, set it before triggering data loading.

Parameters
t_strip_charsa set of characters previously populated with characters to be stripped.
See also
getStripChars()

◆ unloadData()

void utils::SlightCSV::unloadData ( void  )

Method to unload data structure from memory. Settings (filename, delimiter, character manipulation settings) are preserved. Data queries cannot be made until loading a data structure. Optional, library will not leak if not used.

See also
loadData()
